description: It's not just Matplotlib any more... there are more options than ever for creating graphs and visualisations in Python. Libraries now come with beautiful styling, data-friendly colour schemes, interactive plots, Jupyter integration, online hosting and more. Seaborn, ggplot, bokeh, plotly.... where should a newbie start? Is it worth the effort of switching from your current favourite to something new? In this talk I'll outline the strengths and capabilities of some popular libraries.
title: Visualising data with Python
